title: Importing calendar from windows to linux
content:
• I installed Thunderbird on pop-os linux (flatpack).
  • Copied the *default-release directory from win to pop-os
  • Imported *default-release directory
  • The mail messages came over fine.
  • The calendars from win appear on the left
  • But none of the events or tasks from win appear on pop-os

I followed what steps I've found on line. I thought that if the mail came over, the other data should also be there. It appears at some of the calendar information made it, but not the events, etc.

I don't want to re-enter events manually. Is there something missing above?
creator: 82org

title: Some of my messages are lines of html coding and not the message described in the subject line
content:
Sometimes my email messages display lines of html formatting code and not the message mentioned in the subject line. For example, subject is "Is Letting Your Dog Eat Grass a Good Idea?" and message displays 

                                   <tr>                    <td>

title: outgoin email
content: Every time I try to send an email to Germany with address ending @yahoo.de I get an error message "AUP#Out-1120" I have previously sent to the same address with no problem.
creator: rhartle

title: Emails coming through as Applemail
content: When I opened my Thunderbird account today, on my Android laptop, I couldn't read most of my emails because they said they were Applemail. This happening even though Thunderbird is my default email provider.
creator: kas1

title: Empty Trash Folder
content: The Trash folder suddenly shows no messages contained. The folder repair procedure did not fix the problem. Reinstalling the app did not change the problem. How can this be fixed without loosing settings or data?
creator: joefriend1

title: New to Thunderbird and very confused
content: I have 2 email addresses. A personal one (outlook.com) and a business one (live.com). I have set them both up on Thunderbird and they seem to be coming through without any problems. BUT, I am now the only one who gets the live.com emails (through to my laptop via Thunderbird). Yesterday I alerted my husband that he had a couple of business emails to deal with which he does on his ipad via the mail app, and when he opened it, he had absolutely nothing there where there are normally quite a lot of emails there due to all of the mailing lists that our business has ended up on. He is not very happy about losing access to his emails and wants me to get rid of Thunderbird which I really dont want to do. Has anyone got any idea why this is happening please? I have spent hours reading about things that say to tick a box that says to leave messages on the server, but I feel I have looked everywhere multiple times and just cant find this box. Thanks in advance.
creator: traci1503

title: How do I mute all email notifications in all folders except my main Inbox?
content:
Hello,

I have 50 folders in my email account in Thunderbird. They are actually folders for different accounts that are synced as IMAP folders for my account. I occasionally want to check the emails in those other folders, but I only want to be notified of emails that come into my main Inbox.

This is especially annoying on GNOME.

Any tips?

Thanks!
creator: firefox2506
